species.name: Clownfish
species.info: Bright orange fish known for their symbiotic relationship with sea anemones. These colorful fish are immune to anemone stings and help protect their host.
species.habitat: Coral reefs in warm tropical waters

species.name: Angelfish
species.info: Elegant fish with vibrant colors and graceful swimming patterns. Popular in both wild reefs and aquarium settings.

species.name: Parrotfish
species.info: Colorful reef fish known for their beak-like mouths and role in creating sand beaches through coral consumption.

species.name: Whale
species.info: The largest animals on Earth, these gentle giants migrate thousands of miles and communicate through complex songs.

species.name: Manatee
species.info: Gentle 'sea cows' that graze on seagrass. These peaceful mammals are known for their docile nature.

species.name: Great White Shark
species.info: Apex predator of the oceans with powerful jaws and keen senses. Essential for maintaining marine ecosystem balance.

species.name: Hammerhead Shark
species.info: Distinctive shark species with a unique hammer-shaped head that provides enhanced sensory capabilities.
species.habitat: Warm coastal waters and continental shelves

species.name: Moon Jellyfish
species.info: Translucent, bell-shaped jellyfish that drift gracefully through the water. One of the most common jellyfish species.

species.name: Stingray
species.info: Flattened cartilaginous fish with a venomous barb on their tail. Despite their reputation, they are generally peaceful.

species.name: Manta Ray
species.info: Majestic giants of the sea with wingspans that can reach over 20 feet. These gentle filter feeders are highly intelligent.
species.habitat: Open ocean and coral reef areas

species.name: Sea Turtle
species.info: Ancient mariners that have navigated the oceans for millions of years. They return to the same beaches to nest.
species.habitat: Warm coastal waters and nesting beaches

species.name: Marine Iguana
species.info: The world's only marine lizard, found exclusively in the Galápagos Islands. They can dive up to 30 feet to feed.
species.habitat: Rocky shores and shallow waters of Galápagos

species.name: Giant Pacific Octopus
species.info: The largest octopus species in the world, known for their intelligence and complex behaviors. Can grow to enormous sizes.
species.habitat: Rocky dens in the North Pacific Ocean
species.diet: Sharks, fish, crabs, and other cephalopods
